message: Interesting, perhaps this is why MSFT claims that TASKs have no CPU affinity rather than saying Thread affinity. But I think the sample is too simplistic because it implies there is a BCL equivalent call to the .NET statement of WriteAsynch. What happens when some simple .NET statements like "var a = 10 + 12" happens? That code must be run on a thread using Gen'd IML code. In fact, when debugging Task.Factory.Start.... in the debugger by threads, we see a new thread for each start don't we?
